title: Add upcoming command to show scheduled tasks
description:
## Problem
There's no `thingies upcoming` command to show tasks scheduled for future dates.

## Current available commands
```
areas, inbox, projects, search, snapshot, tags, tasks, today
```

## Proposed behavior
`thingies upcoming` should show tasks that are:
- Scheduled for future dates (`start = 2` in database)
- Not completed (`status = 0`)
- Sorted by scheduled date

## Database query logic
```sql
SELECT ... FROM TMTask t
WHERE t.start = 2        -- scheduled for future
  AND t.status = 0       -- incomplete
  AND t.trashed = 0
ORDER BY t.startDate ASC -- binary-packed date sorts correctly
```

## Implementation
1. Add `internal/cmd/upcoming.go` (similar to `today.go` and `inbox.go`)
2. Add query method to `internal/db/queries.go`
3. Register command in `internal/cmd/root.go`

## Output
Should show scheduled date (decoded from binary format) and task title, grouped or sorted by date.

title: Always show IDs in all output
description:
Every task, project, and area must display its UUID in all output formats. IDs are essential for subsequent update/delete/complete operations.

## Problem
Currently, list views and snapshot don't show IDs, making it impossible to copy an ID for follow-up commands without using `--json` or `show`.

## Scope
- Table list views: tasks, projects, areas, search results
- Snapshot command: today, inbox, areas, projects, tasks
- Consider ID format: full UUID vs truncated (first 8 chars)

title: Fix task update --when to use URL scheme instead of AppleScript
description:
## Problem
The `tasks update --when` command uses AppleScript to set `activation date`, but this property is **read-only** in Things 3.

```
execution error: Things3 got an error: Can't set activation date of selected to do to date "Wednesday, January 28, 2026 at 7:37:46 PM". (-10006)
```

## Current (broken) code in `applescript.go`
```go
case "tomorrow":
    statements = append(statements, `set activation date of theTodo to (current date) + 1 * days`)
default:
    statements = append(statements, fmt.Sprintf(`set activation date of theTodo to date "%s"`, params.When))
```

## Solution
Two options depending on the date value:

### For predefined lists (today, tomorrow, anytime, someday)
Use AppleScript `move` command:
```applescript
move theTodo to list "Today"
move theTodo to list "Tomorrow"
move theTodo to list "Anytime"
move theTodo to list "Someday"
```

### For specific dates (YYYY-MM-DD)
Must use Things URL scheme with auth token:
```
things:///update?id=UUID&auth-token=TOKEN&when=2026-02-15
```

## Files to change
- `internal/things/applescript.go`: Use `move to list` for predefined values
- For specific dates, either:
  - Fall back to URL scheme (requires implementing auth token retrieval)
  - Or document as unsupported via AppleScript

title: Show project ID and heading ID in task details view
description:
In the task details view (thingies tasks show <uuid>), add:
- Project UUID alongside the project title
- Heading UUID and title if the task is under a heading

Currently the output shows project_title but not project_uuid, and heading info may be missing entirely. This makes it harder to use the CLI output for scripting or follow-up operations that need these IDs.

title: Fix binary-packed date decoding in scanner.go
description:
## Problem
The `thingsDateToNullTime()` function in `internal/db/scanner.go` incorrectly treats `startDate` as an epoch-based timestamp. It's actually a binary-packed date.

## Current (wrong) code
```go
const thingsDateEpoch = 1636588800
unixTime := int64(ts.Float64) + thingsDateEpoch
```

## Correct decoding
`startDate` packs year/month/day into bits:
- Bits 16-26: Year (11 bits)
- Bits 12-15: Month (4 bits)
- Bits 7-11: Day (5 bits)

```go
y_mask := 0x7FF0000  // bits 16-26
m_mask := 0xF000     // bits 12-15
d_mask := 0xF80      // bits 7-11

year := (startDate & y_mask) >> 16
month := (startDate & m_mask) >> 12
day := (startDate & d_mask) >> 7
```

## Verification
Tested with known values:
- 132786048 â†’ 2026-02-15 âœ“
- 132783616 â†’ 2026-01-28 âœ“
- 132759680 â†’ 2025-12-01 âœ“

- `internal/db/scanner.go`: Replace `thingsDateToNullTime()` with binary decoding
